pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:0.4.eng: 2. The training rule on physical contact

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī araññe viharati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Udāyī was staying in the wilderness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.3.pli: Tassāyasmato vihāro abhirūpo hoti dassanīyo pāsādiko, majjhegabbho, samantāpariyāgāro,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.3.eng: He had a beautiful dwelling with a room in the middle and corridors on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.4.eng: The bed and bench were nicely made up,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.5.eng: and the water for drinking and the water for washing were ready for use.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.6.comm: For the rendering of pariveṇa as “yard”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.7.pli: Bahū manussā āyasmato udāyissa vihārapekkhakā āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.7.eng: Many people came to see Udāyī’s dwelling,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.8.pli: Aññataropi brāhmaṇo sapajāpatiko yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.8.eng: among them a certain brahmin and his wife. They approached Udāyī and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.9.eng: “Venerable, we would like to see your dwelling.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.11.pli: avāpuraṇaṃ ādāya ghaṭikaṃ ugghāṭetvā kavāṭaṃ paṇāmetvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.11.eng: Udāyī took the key, lifted the latch, opened the door, and entered the dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.12.pli: Sopi kho brāhmaṇo āyasmato udāyissa piṭṭhito pāvisi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.13.pli: Sāpi kho brāhmaṇī tassa brāhmaṇassa piṭṭhito pāvisi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī ekacce vātapāne vivaranto ekacce vātapāne thakento gabbhaṃ anuparigantvā piṭṭhito āgantvā tassā brāhmaṇiyā aṅgamaṅgāni parāmasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.14.eng: Opening some windows and closing others, Udāyī walked around the inner room and came up behind the brahmin lady, touching her all over.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.15.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo āyasmatā udāyinā saddhiṃ paṭisammoditvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.15.eng: Then the brahmin thanked Udāyī and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.16.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo attamano attamanavācaṃ nicchāresi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.17.pli: “uḷārā ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā ye ime evarūpe araññe viharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.17.eng: “These Sakyan monastics who live in the wilderness are superb.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.18.pli: Bhavampi udāyī uḷāro yo evarūpe araññe viharatī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.19.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sā brāhmaṇī taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.21.pli: Yatheva me tvaṃ aṅgamaṅgāni parāmasi evameva me samaṇo udāyī aṅgamaṅgāni parāmasī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.21.eng: He touched me all over just like you do.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.22.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.22.eng: The brahmin then complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.23.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are shameless and immoral liars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.24.pli: Ime hi nāma dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā paṭijānissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.24.eng: They claim to have integrity, to be celibate and of good conduct, to be truthful, moral, and good.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.25.pli: Natthi imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ natthi imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.25.eng: But they don’t have the good character of a monastic or a brahmin.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.26.pli: kuto imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ kuto imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, apagatā ime sāmaññā apagatā ime brahmaññā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.27.pli: Kathañhi nāma samaṇo udāyī mama bhariyāya aṅgamaṅgāni parāmasissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.27.eng: How could the ascetic Udāyī touch my wife all over?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.28.pli: Na hi sakkā kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi ārāmaṃ vā vihāraṃ vā gantuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.28.eng: It’s not possible to go to a monastery or a monk’s dwelling with a wife from a respectable family, or with a daughter, a girl, a daughter-in-law, or a female slave from a respectable family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.29.pli: Sace kulitthiyo kuladhītaro kulakumāriyo kulasuṇhāyo kuladāsiyo ārāmaṃ vā vihāraṃ vā gaccheyyuṃ, tāpi samaṇā sakyaputtiyā dūseyyun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.29.eng: If you do, the Sakyan monastics might molest them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhu tassa brāhmaṇassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.1.eng: The monks heard the criticism of that brahmin.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.3.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī make physical contact with a woman?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.5.eng: He then had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.6.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.9.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.9.eng: “Foolish man, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.10.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjissasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.11.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito no sarāgāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.11.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.12.eng: the stilling of the fevers of worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyya hatthaggāhaṃ vā veṇiggāhaṃ vā aññatarassa vā aññatarassa vā aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, makes physical contact with a woman—holding her hand or hair, or touching any part of her body—he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.6.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.11.pli: Api ca rattaṃ cittaṃ imasmiṃ atthe adhippetaṃ vipariṇatanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.11.eng: But in this case “distorted” refers to the lustful mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.13.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī na petī, na tiracchānagatā. Antamaso tadahujātāpi dārikā, pageva mahattarī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.13.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; even a girl born on that very day, let alone an older one.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.19.eng: from the elbow to the tip of the nails.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.21.pli: suddhakesā vā, suttamissā vā, mālāmissā vā, hiraññamissā vā, suvaṇṇamissā vā, muttāmissā vā, maṇimissā vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.21.eng: just the hair; or the hair with strings in it, with a garland, with gold coins, with gold, with pearls, or with gems.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.21.comm: “Gold coins” renders hirañña. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.23.pli: hatthañca veṇiñca ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ aṅgaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.23.eng: anything apart from the hand and the hair is called “any part of her body”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.1.pli: Āmasanā, parāmasanā, omasanā, ummasanā, olaṅghanā, ullaṅghanā, ākaḍḍhanā, patikaḍḍhanā, abhiniggaṇhanā, abhinippīḷanā, gahaṇaṃ, chupanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.1.eng: Physical contact, touching, stroking downwards, stroking upwards, pulling down, lifting up, pulling, pushing, squeezing, pressing, taking hold of, contacting.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.19.eng: taking hold of a bodily part and then pressing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.26.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.27.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.0.3.eng: Making direct contact with a single person or animal: body to body

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.1.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca bhikkhu ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.1.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.2.pli: Naṃ itthiyā kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati omasati ummasati olaṅgheti ullaṅgheti ākaḍḍhati patikaḍḍhati abhiniggaṇhāti abhinippīḷeti gaṇhāti chupati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.2.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her, strokes her downwards, strokes her upwards, pulls her down, lifts her up, pulls her, pushes her, squeezes her, presses her, takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.3.pli: Itthī ca hoti vematiko sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.3.eng: It is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.4.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.4.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.5.eng: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.6.pli: Itthī ca hoti paṇḍakasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.6.eng: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a paṇḍaka, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.6.comm: For the meaning of the term paṇḍaka, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.7.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.7.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.8.eng: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.9.pli: Itthī ca hoti purisasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.9.eng: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a man, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.10.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.10.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.11.eng: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.12.pli: Itthī ca hoti tiracchānagatasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.12.eng: It is a woman, but he perceives her as an animal, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.13.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.13.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.14.eng: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.15.pli: Paṇḍako ca hoti paṇḍakasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.15.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, he perceives him as a paṇḍaka, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.16.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ paṇḍakassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.16.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the paṇḍaka, body to body, if he touches him …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.17.eng: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.18.pli: Paṇḍako ca hoti vematiko sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.18.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he is unsure of it, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.19.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ paṇḍakassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.19.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the paṇḍaka, body to body, if he touches him …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.20.eng: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.21.pli: Paṇḍako ca hoti purisasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.21.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he perceives him as a man, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.22.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ paṇḍakassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.22.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the paṇḍaka, body to body, if he touches him …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.23.eng: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.24.pli: Paṇḍako ca hoti tiracchānagatasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.24.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he perceives him as an animal, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.25.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ paṇḍakassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.25.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the paṇḍaka, body to body, if he touches him …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.26.eng: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.27.pli: Paṇḍako ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.27.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he perceives him as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.28.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ paṇḍakassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.28.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the paṇḍaka, body to body, if he touches him …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.29.eng: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.30.pli: Puriso ca hoti purisasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.30.eng: It is a man, he perceives him as a man, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.31.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ purisassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.31.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the man, body to body, if he touches him …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.32.eng: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.33.eng: It is a man, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.34.eng: It is a man, but he perceives him as an animal …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.35.eng: It is a man, but he perceives him as a woman …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.36.pli: puriso ca hoti paṇḍakasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.36.eng: It is a man, but he perceives him as a paṇḍaka, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.37.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ purisassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.37.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the man, body to body, if he touches him …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.38.eng: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.39.pli: Tiracchānagato ca hoti tiracchānagatasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.39.eng: It is an animal, he perceives it as an animal, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.40.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ tiracchānagatassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.40.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the animal, body to body, if he touches it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.41.eng: takes hold of it, contacts it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.42.eng: It is an animal, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.43.eng: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a woman …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.44.eng: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a paṇḍaka …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.46.eng: but he perceives it as a man, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.47.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ tiracchānagatassa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.47.eng: If the monk makes physical contact with the animal, body to body, if he touches it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.48.eng: takes hold of it, contacts it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.49.eng: The section based on one item is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.49.comm: See Appendix of Specialized Vocabulary under mūlaka.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.0.eng: Making direct contact with two beings of the same kind: body to body

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.1.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.1.eng: It is two women, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.0.eng: Others making direct contact with a monk: body to body

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.1.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.1.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.2.pli: Itthī ca naṃ bhikkhussa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati parāmasati omasati ummasati olaṅgheti ullaṅgheti ākaḍḍhati patikaḍḍhati abhiniggaṇhāti abhinippīḷeti gaṇhāti chupati, sevanādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.2.eng: If the woman makes physical contact with the monk, body to body, if she touches him, strokes him downwards, strokes him upwards, pulls him down, lifts him up, pulls him, pushes him, squeezes him, presses him, takes hold of him, contacts him, and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, he commits an offense entailing suspension. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.3.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.3.eng: It is two women, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.4.pli: Itthiyo ca naṃ bhikkhussa kāyena kāyaṃ āmasanti parāmasanti omasanti ummasanti olaṅghenti ullaṅghenti ākaḍḍhanti patikaḍḍhanti abhiniggaṇhanti abhinippīḷenti gaṇhanti chupanti, sevanādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, āpatti dvinnaṃ saṅghādisesānaṃ …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.4.eng: If the women make physical contact with the monk, body to body, if they touch him, stroke him downwards, stroke him upwards, pull him down, lift him up, pull him, push him, squeeze him, press him, take hold of him, contact him, and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, he commits two offenses entailing suspension. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.5.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.5.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.50.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.50.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.51.pli: Ubho ca naṃ bhikkhussa nissaggiyena kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ āmasanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.51.eng: If they both, with something released by both, make physical contact with something connected to his body,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.52.pli: Sevanādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.52.eng: and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.53.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.53.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.54.pli: Itthī ca naṃ bhikkhussa nissaggiyena nissaggiyaṃ āmasati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.54.eng: If the woman, with something released by her, makes physical contact with something released by him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.55.pli: Sevanādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati, na ca phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.55.eng: and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.55.comm: Sp 1.278: Ettha ca kāyena vāyamati na ca phassaṁ paṭivijānātīti attanā nissaṭṭhaṁ pupphaṁ vā phalaṁ vā itthiṁ attano nissaggiyena pupphena vā phalena vā paharantiṁ disvā kāyena vikāraṁ karoti, aṅguliṁ vā cāleti, bhamukaṁ vā ukkhipati, akkhiṁ vā nikhaṇati, aññaṁ vā evarūpaṁ vikāraṁ karoti, ayaṁ vuccati “kāyena vāyamati na ca phassaṁ paṭivijānātī”ti; “Here ʻmakes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact’ means: having seen a flower or fruit released from oneself hitting a flower or fruit released from the woman, he makes a gesture with the body, wags a finger, raises an eyebrow, winks, or makes any similar gesture—this is called ʻmakes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact’.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.56.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.56.eng: It is two women, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.58.eng: and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.59.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.59.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.60.pli: Ubho ca naṃ bhikkhussa nissaggiyena nissaggiyaṃ āmasanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.60.eng: If they both, with something released by both, make physical contact with something released by him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.61.eng: and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.1.pli: Sevanādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.1.eng: If, aiming at connection, he makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.2.pli: Sevanādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati, na ca phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.2.eng: If, aiming at connection, he makes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.3.pli: Sevanādhippāyo na ca kāyena vāyamati, phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.3.eng: If, aiming at connection, he makes no effort with the body, but experiences contact, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.4.pli: Sevanādhippāyo na ca kāyena vāyamati, na ca phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.4.eng: If, aiming at connection, he makes no effort with the body and does not experience contact, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.5.pli: Mokkhādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati, phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.5.eng: If, aiming to free himself, he makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.6.pli: Mokkhādhippāyo kāyena vāyamati, na ca phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.6.eng: If, aiming to free himself, he makes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.7.pli: Mokkhādhippāyo na ca kāyena vāyamati, phassaṃ paṭivijānāti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.7.eng: If, aiming to free himself, he makes no effort with the body, but experiences contact, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.8.eng: If, aiming to free himself, he makes no effort with the body and does not experience contact, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu mātuyā mātupemena āmasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.4.eng: Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing suspension?”
